name: Dianamar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've traveled extensively throughout Europe and stayed at many hotels and B&Bs. I often don't take the time to write reviews, but for me, this was by far the least acceptable accommodation I have ever stayed in. I normally stay in mid-range places, anywhere from 100-150 Euros a night, sometimes less/more, and I never unrealistically expect perfection. There were a handful of reviews for the Dianamar, all positive when I had booked, and I thought at 60 Euros a night I could definitely do without AC or a TV, since the accommodations were in a great location, and the rooms seemed nice coupled with special touches (e.g., beach towels, parasols, afternoon cake, etc.).
reviews.title: Not for everyone and definitely not for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean, and for us the size of the room/bathroom was fine, and the location was fantastic (only a 5 minute walk to the beach). The breakfast in the morning was plentiful (homemade bread, cold cuts, fresh fruit, etc.) but here is what caused my husband and I to check-out two nights earlier than we had booked...
reviews.title: Stay Away

reviews.text: The mattresses, at least in the room we had, needed to be replaced - my mattress sagged, springs were poking into me, and I've never heard so much creaking which kept waking up my husband as I tossed and turned all night (it was two separate mattresses pushed together). Worst night of non-sleep I ever had, my body was numb, seriously considered sleeping on the floor, ruined my night and also the next day for me since I was sleep deprived. Just because you only charge 60 Euros a night does not give you the right to not replace your mattresses when required - I travel extensively and do not have high expectations of mattresses by the way. The other annoyance was the lack of the shower head being mounted. I'm on a hot beach vacation, covered in sunscreen, sand, and sweat and not being able to go back to my hotel and properly wash off was a huge inconvenience, made worse because the water would go back and forth from being cold and lukewarm, and there was almost no water pressure, and little running water makes it hard to properly clean yourself. I felt so unclean and greasy during my stay.
reviews.title: The saviour of our holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the poor "sleep" and inability to properly cleanse ourselves, the fact that there was no AC also became an issue since the problems were piling up and our tolerance levels were going down. We constantly ran the fan they provided us, but in 35 degree heat it was still uncomfortable and hot/sweaty in the room, and I might as well mention the fan is really loud when you are trying to sleep (I slept with ear plugs), and be aware that if you turn the fan off, in our room at least, you will hear the insects steadily chirping right outside so not a quiet sleep regardless. They also do not have shutters or black-out curtains, so the room is full of light at the crack of dawn.
reviews.title: Charming
Dianamar is great
reviews.text: This is already such a long review, so I won't bother getting into the details of us checking-out early and how rude and unprofessional Eva was to us, embarrassing us in front of guests, etc. It is a shame she did not care to learn why we were leaving early. She seemed to assume it was because we were expecting a 5 star hotel, when all we wanted was a comfortable sleep, and a proper shower. Even my laid back husband who never complains about anything could not wait to get out of there and was the one who prompted us to find another accommodation while we were out walking.

description: Dianamar Bed and Breakfast by the Seais perfectly situated only 200 metres from the lovely Albufeira beach and a short walk (300 metres) to the centre of Albufeira with it's many restaurants, bars and shops. This small and cosy home away from home is owned by a Swedish family. Dianamar is recommended by several travel guides (Lonely Planet, Rough Guide, Let´s Go, Guide Routard, Geoguide, ...).You will find Dianamar in a small and quiet street in the heart of Rossio, a nice and quiet old quarter of Albufeira.Our roof terrace has sun beds, shower, tables and chairs. From this terrace you have a splendid view of Albufeira, the beach, the ocean and the marina.When you stay at Dianamar you get: Breakfast buffet, snacks and drinks, safety boxes, free wifi internet and laundry service. You can watch several international cable channels in our TV-room.Our breakfast buffet is served from 8 am to 11 am. You can also buy sandwiches, lunchboxes, afternoon tea, coffee etc. Dianamar has different types of rooms (single, double and triple rooms) at reasonable prices. All rooms have a private balcony. Some rooms have sea view. All rooms have private wc and bathroom.We arrange transport to and from Faro Airport at favourable prices. .We can also help you with car rentals from Dianamar or from the airport. Larger groups are very welcome. We can help you to organize special programs for your group (dinner parties, excursions etc).Dianamar welcomes guests from April to October.
